revised_title: Atmospheric Electric Potential Results at Kew: A Seven-Year Study
tldr: This article presents a study of atmospheric electric potential results at Kew from selected days between 1898 to 1904. The author discusses the changes made to the experimental setup and the methods used to obtain accurate measurements. The study found that potential gradient is a highly variable element, with a well-marked minimum near midsummer and a possible second minimum in January. The author also discusses the influence of fog and the potential relationship between electric potential gradient and the sunspot cycle.
